page.title: 16Moorland Close, Eaglesfield
page.content: Moorland Close Farm is the birthplace of{Fletcher Christian}leader of the {Mutiny on the 'Bounty'in 1789. Fletcher Christian was born to Charles and Ann Christian in 1764. Now the farm is owned by{Robin Bell who has lived there all his life.The farm covers{238 acres}and has 80 milking cows and 55 beef cattle.Also on the farm there are 76 sheep but 50 of them are lambs,the rest are ewes.Mr Bell has got 4 tractors,(1 John Deere, 3 David Browns) and 1 Land Rover .The cows are milked twice a day,once at 6 am and once at 4 pm.The crops on the farm are grass and 30 acres of barley which is mainly feed for the animals.Most of the milk on the farm goes to the{Milk Marketing {Board}at{Aspatria.
